data.title: It's Okay
data.text: Nothing really stands out here. I don't want to bag on the place at all, but it's a typical strip mall Mexican food sort of place. I wouldn't search it out, and I don't actively avoid it. If you're nearby and hungry it fits the bill.

data.title: Nothing special can be said.  Many other local places with better food
data.text: Reminds me of the most plastic cafeteria in New York.  Haven't had anything that really tasted fresh.  Chips somewhat stale. Guess if I can't say anything nice, I should not say anything about this place.  Go to Gauchito next door...or drive to Mr. Taco

data.title: Pretty decent Mexican take-out
data.text:
Whenever I visit San Marcos on business I stay at the local Hampton Inn and I find Sombrero Mexican Food to be very convenient, as it’s a very short drive from the hotel.  The center in which this eatery is located (Civic Center Plaza) actually has a variety of dining options, from full table service to fast food.

Sombrero Mexican Food is a local quick service chain with 15-20 locations, most of which are	 in San Diego County.  The burritos are tasty and filling, and I particularly enjoy the rolled tacos here.  They also feature a salsa bar with a good selection of options.

Every time I’ve visited this restaurant the food has been enjoyable and the service efficient.  That sort of dependability is greatly appreciated by this business traveler.
